Internet Remarks: Inspired by the beauty and simplicity of a Nordic family farmhouse, this custom home has a presence unlike any other in the neighbourhood. With black Cedar siding and a dark metal roof, it is sleek and contemporary. Inside is light and bright with windows intentionally placed to take in the expansive views. The heart of the home is the elegant kitchen with its 12’ Carrera quartz island, Italian porcelain backsplash, and top of the line appliances. Wake to the sunrise or fall asleep to the gentle sway of the bamboo in the sanctuary that is the Master Suite. The upper floor is for the kids, with 2 beds and 2 full baths. The lofted playroom is open to below, keeping communication open, but still fostering independence. Extended family can have privacy on the lower floor with their own bedroom and a full bathroom. Contemporary elegance and functional family spaces don’t often go hand in hand. When you add a beautiful island setting that’s so close to Vancouver, you’ll need to look no further for your dream home.

Three bedroom main home overlooking a sand and pebble beach with views across Active Pass and a 700 sq ft cottage with its own fantastic ocean views. This unique 1.37 acre property is tucked into the Southwest corner of Georgeson Bay and is rich with marine life. Seals, Sea Lions and migratory sea birds are a constant in the bay and whales are a common site. Features a 22 x 14 seaside boat house and a Cedar sauna next to main house.
Realtor Remarks: Property available for viewing by appointment beginning March 26, 27, 28. More information in the Ocean section at Landquest.com Please contact listing agent by email for appointments: DS@landquest.com

Public Remarks: Last night I dreamt of the perfect home, it was located in a quiet cul de sac at the base of Grouse Mountain. Our family went skiing & hiking together, then at the end of a long day - we sat in front of our wood burning fireplace & roasted marshmallows. The dream continued... I prepared for work the next day in my home office & the kids walked to school with their friends in the neighbourhood. I made a cup of coffee & looked out from my desk, on to nature, but my thoughts were not about work. I was planning dinner for the friends we were having over that evening, because we love to entertain! The only troubling part of my dream was that I couldn't figure out if I should use the downstairs bedroom as a nanny suite or keep it for myself. What would you do?
Realtor Remarks: Pre Listing inspection done by Pillar To Post. Measurements taken from the floor plan. Have clients view the Virtual Tour prior to showing requests. Covid Waiver (in Documents) must be signed prior to viewing. Team Disclosure (in Documents) must accompany any offers.

Extensively renovated in 2006 and 2011, the main home features hardwood floors throughout, a remodelled kitchen with stainless steel appliances and engineered stone counters, updated bathrooms, updated roof, windows, electrical, plumbing, and perimeter drain tile.  Built in 2018, the 840 square foot, 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, 2 story laneway house has a gorgeous West Coast Contemporary design and is still under warranty.  It features a full sized laundry and kitchen, as well as stone countertops, custom cabinetry, engineered hardwood and polished concrete floors, an alarm system, external storage room, and a parking pad wired for electric vehicle charging. Minutes to Highway 1, shopping, T&T market, Rupert and Sunrise Parks, and Sir Matthew Begbie Elementary School.
